title: India Is The New 'Laboratory' For Agentic AI, Says Qualcomm Chief Cristiano Amon
description: The future of Artificial Intelligence (AI) won't reside solely in distant data centers; it will live in your pocket, on your desk, and in your car. That is the core vision of Qualcomm President Cristiano R. Amon, who while speaking to NDTV said that he sees India not just as a consumer market, but as a critical launching pad for the next great wave of technology. Especially in the convergence of AI and 6G connectivity.

title: Ozak AI: Pioneering Intelligent Blockchain Evolution in 2025
description: Ozak AI is revolutionizing blockchain technology by integrating artificial intelligence, aiming to redefine the crypto landscape. While Solana excels in scalability, Ozak AI focuses on intelligence, merging AI for smarter blockchain operations. With strong partnerships and a successful presale, Ozak AI is poised to lead the new era of decentralized innovation.
content: As the crypto market in 2025 moves towards transformational innovation, Solana and a newcomer, Ozak AI, are at the forefront of this exciting evolution. Solana continues to solidify its status with exceptional scalability and fast transaction speeds,... [941 chars]

title: PM Modi meets Qualcomm CEO, discusses India's strides in AI, innovation and skilling
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India offers unmatched talent and scale to build technologies that will shape the world's collective future. His remarks came after a meeting with Cristiano R. Amon, President and CEO of Qualcomm, highlighting India's growing role in semiconductor and artificial intelligence (AI) innovation.
content:
New Delhi [India], October 11 (ANI): Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday met Cristiano R. Amon, President and CEO of Qualcomm, and discussed India's advancements in artificial intelligence, innovation, and skilling.
The Prime Minister expressed ... [2030 chars]

title: Centre To Introduce AI In School Curriculum From Class 3 Onwards From Academic Year 2026-27
description: The Ministry of Education will introduce Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the school curriculum from Class 3 onwards starting 2026-27. A framework by CBSE is being developed for AI integration across grades. The move aims to prepare students and teachers for the digital economy, aligning with NITI Aayog’s call for building an AI-ready workforce.
content: New Delhi: The Ministry of Education is set to introduce Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the school curriculum for all students from Class 3 onwards from next academic year (2026-27) and a framework is being developed for AI integration across grades... [1633 chars]

title: AI isn’t the dot-com bubble, but that won’t stop it from ending badly
description: Artificial intelligence has gone from a cool toy to a prime mover of both the economy and the stock market. Here are four ways the rally could end.

title: Apple Sued Over Use Of Copyrighted Books To Train Apple Intelligence
description: Apple was hit with a lawsuit in California federal court by a pair of neuroscientists who say that the tech company misused thousands of copyrighted books to train its Apple Intelligence artificial intelligence model.
content:

title: One of the world's biggest AI companies wants a deal with Canada. Is sovereignty the trade-off?
description: OpenAI wants to help Canada build a sovereign digital infrastructure for artificial intelligence, putting the country in a tough spot as it tries to distance itself from overreliance on U.S. tech companies and the American government.
content:
One of the world's biggest artificial intelligence companies is knocking on Canada's door, potentially armed with an offer that — under normal circumstances — would be hard to refuse.

title: Will AI make or break Canada? Innovators, researchers call for more guardrails
description: As the Carney government promotes artificial intelligence as part of its bid to grow the Canadian economy, some inventors who use the technology and experts who study its impacts are calling on Ottawa to add more guardrails — something the federal government is actively examining.
